title: analytics/mediawiki/wikistories_consumption_event
description: An event related to the consumption of story content from Extension:Wikistories. A "story" is essentially a slideshow of images with superimposed text; a "frame" is one of the individual slides.

event_type.description:
The type of event that occurred:
* story_impression: A story becomes visible to the user for the first time during a page view. If multiple adjacent stories are visible, each one results in a simultaneous impression event. Any stories that have overflowed produce impressions only when scrolled into view.
* story_view: The user finishes viewing a story, whether they viewed it to the end or closed it early.
* experiment_pageview: A consumer enrolled in a Wikistories experiment finishes viewing any page on the wiki. This should be sent whenever the page is closed or hidden, which may result in duplicate events.

activity_session_id.description: A random ID for the current session. Available from `mw.eventLog.id.getSessionId()`.

pageview_id.description: A random ID for the current pageview. Available from `mw.user.getPageviewToken()`.

access_method.description: Which interface the user is using to access the wiki. Note that "mobile web" uses a space rather than an underscore.

page_title.description: The page the user is currently viewing.

page_story_count.description: The number of stories attached to the page the user is currently viewing.

page_visible_time.description: The amount of time (in milliseconds) the page has been visible so far during the current pageview.

story_open_time.description: The amount of time (in milliseconds) the user has had a story open so far during the current pageview. This time is also counted toward page visible time.

referrer_type.description: The type of web site given in the referrer header. This is the same classification used in our main page view data.

story_title.description: The title of the current story. Applies only to story_impression and story_view events.

story_frame_count.description: The number of frames (slides) in the current story. Applies only to story_impression and story_view events.

story_frames_viewed.description: The number of frames that the user viewed from the current story. Applies only to story_view events.

story_completed.description: Whether the user viewed all the frames of the current story. Applies only to story_view events.

next_story_opened.description: Whether the user opened the story recommended in an extra frame at the end of the current story. Null if there is no such recommendation. Applies only to story_view events.

experiment_group.description: The experiment group the user is currently enrolled in. Null if the user is not currently involved in a Wikistories experiment.

experiment_entry_date.description: The date on which the user was enrolled in the experiment. The specific time is not included because this might be unique enough to allow us to link a specific user's sessions.

session_is_first_of_day.description: Whether this is the first activity session that the user *started* today, which tells us that this session represents a new unique user for the day. To know when a new activity session starts, we can use `mw.trackSubscribe('sessionReset', â€¦)`.

session_days.description: A list of the days on which the user *started* an activity session. Days are given relative to the experiment entry date, so the entry date is stored as 1, the following days is stored as 2, and so on. The same days should not be listed more than once.

$schema.description: A URI identifying the JSONSchema for this event. This should match an schema's $id in a schema repository. E.g. /schema/title/1.0.0

uri.description: Unique URI identifying the event or entity

request_id.description: Unique ID of the request that caused the event

dt.description: UTC event datetime, in ISO-8601 format

domain.description: Domain the event or entity pertains to

stream.description: Name of the stream/queue/dataset that this event belongs in
